paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses BRCA2 mutations in the context of phenocopies and evaluates the presence of mosaicism in non-carrier relatives. One specific BRCA2 variant was identified.

patients.phenotype: affected with two synchronous tumours (BrCa and pancreatic cancer)

individual_records.phenotype_details: two synchronous tumours (BrCa and pancreatic cancer)
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The only exception is patient 4-e, who was included because affected at the age of 58 with two synchronous tumours belonging to the clinical spectrum of BRCA mutations (BrCa and pancreatic cancer).

functional_data.summary: The variant was analyzed for mosaicism using sensitive methods.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation was not detected in the healthy parents, suggesting a de novo occurrence.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests that somatic mosaicism is not likely to be common in BRCA1/2 families.
key_quotes: In family 8, all the genotyping assays did not detect mosaicism in the phenocopy or her healthy parents, supporting the hypothesis of a de novo occurrence of the BRCA2 mutation identified in the proband.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information regarding the BRCA2 variant.
